channel.title: International: Top News And Analysis
channel.description: CNBC International is the world leader for news on business, technology, China, trade, oil prices, the Middle East and markets.

item.title: Japan stocks lead gains in Asia-Pacific markets after Wall Street rally overnight
item.description: Traders in Asia assess revised trade data from South Korea and non-oil exports data from Singapore.

item.title: Ex-Google CEO Eric Schmidt sees Nvidia as big AI winner: 'You know what to do in the stock market'
item.description: Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt said in a recent talk at Stanford that, while he isn't giving investment advice, Nvidia is the top beneficiary of the AI boom.

item.title: TikTok 'finfluencers' accurately called the AI rally, but credibility concerns dog them
item.description: Experts warned against trusting advice from these finfluencers, but agreed that they provide a first step to promote investing awareness among young investors.

item.title: Warren Buffett did something curious with his Apple stock holding
item.description: The identical 400 million share count in Apple and Buffett's oldest and longest position Coca-Cola prompted some to believe he is done selling the tech stock.

item.title: CNBC Daily Open: Live long and prosper
item.description: S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite had a sixth consecutive day of gains, rising 1.61% and 2.34% respectively, while the Dow Jones Industrial Average surged 554 points

item.title: Alibaba earnings miss expectations despite cloud acceleration
item.description: Alibaba continues to face headwinds in its core e-commerce business amid rising competition and a cautious Chinese consumer.

item.title: A $1.4 million vacation? Take a look inside a yacht that costs that much per week
item.description: The 255-foot superyacht Malia hit the market in 2023 with a price tag of $120 million. But she can be yours for $1.4 million per week.

item.title: North Korea to reopen for international visitors, tour operators say
item.description: North Korea will resume international tourism this winter, ending a COVID-era ban on travelers, according to operators that organize trips to the country.

item.title: 'I see a lot of denial': C-suite advisor says business bosses still expect a Trump win
item.description: U.S. business leaders are "in denial" about Kamala Harris' growing lead over Donald Trump, according to C-suite advisor Tina Fordham.

item.title: China's bond market intervention reveals financial stability worries
item.description: The country's latest efforts to stem a bond market rally shows that authorities are worried about financial stability, analysts said.

item.title: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg receives letter from lawmakers concerned about illicit drug ads on Facebook and Instagram
item.description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers sent Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg a letter expressing concern about illicit drug advertisements running on the company's apps.

item.title: CNBC's Inside India newsletter: Could Hindenburg's latest allegations have wider implications for India?
item.description: Unusually, Hindenburg — a short-seller that makes money when stocks fall — is attacking a market regulator, rather than a specific stock.

item.title: Tencent-backed Airwallex hits $500 million annualized sales, aims to get IPO-ready by 2026
item.description: Payments startup Airwallex has reached an annual revenue run rate of $500 million and will be ready for an IPO by 2026, CEO Jack Zhang told CNBC.

item.title: Goldman Sachs jumps into bitcoin ETFs and one hedge fund gets bullish on miners
item.description: New SEC filings show banks and hedge funds jumping into spot crypto products, though ether ETFs won't be accounted for until November.

item.title: Cisco shares have best day since 2020 on earnings beat, plans to cut 7% of workforce
item.description: Cisco shares jumped on Thursday and were on pace for their best day since November 2020, after the networking company announced layoffs and an earnings beat.

item.title: United CEO expresses 'renewed confidence' in Boeing after meeting with new leader Ortberg
item.description: United's CEO Kirby had lunch with Boeing's new CEO Kelly Ortberg in Texas this week.

item.title: Wizz Air launches $550 'all you can fly' annual subscription pass
item.description: Travelers in Europe can now take unlimited flights for 499 euros ($550) a year under a new travel subscription service from budget carrier Wizz Air.

item.title: Health stocks jump as WHO declares mpox global health emergency
item.description: Shares of Danish vaccine maker Bavarian Nordic jumped as much as 17% Thursday amid a wider rally for associated healthcare stocks following the WHO declaration.

item.title: Biden administration releases prices of 10 drugs in Medicare negotiations, says U.S. will save $6 billion in first year
item.description: It is a milestone in a controversial process that aims to make costly medications more affordable for older Americans but is strongly opposed by drugmakers.

item.title: Amazon to test Prime Air drone delivery service in the UK
item.description: Amazon and six other organizations will take part in a trial that will test the use of drone flights to remote locations.

item.title: Ukraine must decide how its Russian incursion ends — advance further or retreat before it's too late
item.description: Ukraine must decide whether to try to hold or advance its incursion, or to withdraw now before Russia mounts what could be a furious and deadly response.

item.title: Klarna takes on banks with a personal account and cashback rewards ahead of IPO
item.description: Klarna, best known for its buy now, pay later loans, is launching a personal account for deposits and cashback rewards in the U.S. and Europe.

item.title: Consumer spending jumped in July as retail sales were up 1%, much better than expected
item.description: Retail sales were projected to increase 0.3% in July, according to the Dow Jones consensus estimate.

item.title: UK economy expands 0.6% in second quarter; June growth stalls
item.description: GDP has recorded slight but steady growth almost every month so far this year as the U.K. exits a shallow recession.

item.title: Walmart beats estimates, raises outlook as it sees stable consumer health
item.description: Walmart beat quarterly earnings and revenue estimates and hiked its full-year guidance.

item.title: Bank of Japan will take longer to hike rates given the yen's rapid strengthening, BMI says
item.description: Following market turbulence, BOJ's Deputy Governor Uchida Shinichi released a statement affirming that the bank would not raise rates amid market instability.

item.title: China reports slight beat in July retail sales, but industrial data disappoint
item.description: Other data for July released in the last two weeks have indicated consumer demand remains sluggish.

item.title: Japan second-quarter GDP beats expectations, expands 0.8% from previous quarter
item.description: On a year-on-year basis, however, the country's GDP fell for a second straight quarter, down 0.8% after having declined 0.9% in the first quarter.

item.title: Starbucks is giving incoming CEO Brian Niccol $85 million in cash and stock as he departs Chipotle
item.description: Starbucks plans to pay incoming CEO Brian Niccol $10 million in cash and $75 million in equity awards when he joins the company from Chipotle.

item.title: Schumer says a crypto bill can pass Senate this year; key Dems join 'Crypto4Harris' call
item.description: Top Democrats joined virtual town hall to back crypto and a Kamala Harris administration.
